wikipedia_page.main: Daniel Chater (17 November 1870 – 25 May 1959) was a British Labour and Co-operative politician.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1935 United Kingdom general election

response: At the 1945 election, all 11 LCS-sponsored candidates were elected, including Dan Chater in Bethnal Green North East, Percy Holman in Bethnal Green South West and C.S.Ganley in Battersea South. Alfred Barnes, also elected for East Ham South, even became a Cabinet Minister in the Attlee administration after 1945.

In the 1929 General Election Sir John stood unsuccessfully as the Conservative candidate for Hammersmith South. The result of the election in the Hammersmith South constituency was:- Dan Chater (Socialist) 12,630 votes, Sir John Ferguson (Conservative) 12,218 votes, Captain J J Davies (Liberal) 3,796 votes. In August 1929 Sir John became the Member of Parliament for Twickenham after a by-election had been called due to the elevation to the peerage of Sir William Joynson-Hicks as Lord Brentford. The result of the by-election was:- Sir John Ferguson (Conservative) 14,705 votes, Mr J T Mason (Labour) 14,202 votes, Mr F G Paterson (Liberal) 1,920 votes. Sir John died on 17 July 1932 at his home Great Bounds, Southborough, Kent, while still in office.

link_mentions.page: Bethnal Green North East (UK Parliament constituency)
response: *Labour: Dan ChaterReport of the Annual Conference of the Labour Party, 1939.

Prior to becoming an MP he had unsuccessfully contested the Peckham division of Camberwell, at the 1929 general election. At the 1931 general election he contested  Hammersmith South for the Conservatives. This was a seat the party had lost to Labour in 1929 by just over 400 votes. Cooke defeated the incumbent Dan Chater by 12,638 votes to regain the seat for his party. He retained it in 1935 with a reduced majority of 6,068, defeating local councillor W T Adams.
